title: Time for a change on changing the clocks?
text:
Only the wonks among us will be thinking about the potential damage to the economy on Sunday morning as we enjoy an extra hour in bed after the clocks go back.

But this weekend’s shift to Greenwich Mean Time – and longer evenings – inevitably sparks debate over the annual ritual of the switch from British Summer Time. Many campaigners claim we should leave the clocks alone and enjoy the extra daylight – and potentially increased economic productivity – that it brings. The trouble is that there tends to be more heat than (ahem) light in the arguments, and little strong evidence either way.
